unnormalised: So, someone asked me about investing in crypto and honestly, I’ve had my share of ups and downs. Started with a small amount, around ₹5000, just to see what the hype was all about. Back then, Bitcoin was hovering around $40,000. I thought, “Chal, let’s try our luck.”
normalised: So, someone asked me about investing in crypto and honestly, I've had my share of ups and downs. Started with a small amount, around rupee five thousand, just to see what the hype was all about. Back then, Bitcoin was hovering around dollar forty thousand. I thought, "Chal, let's try our luck."

unnormalised: Bought some Ethereum and Dogecoin. Ethereum actually did pretty well, almost doubled my investment at one point! I was feeling like a proper investor. Then came the crash. Lost almost 60% of my initial investment. Ouch. That’s when I realised I needed to learn more. Started reading up on blockchain technology, market trends, the works. Also, started diversifying, putting small amounts in various altcoins – you know, the penny stocks of the crypto world. Some went nowhere, others gave me a 10-20% return.

Also, started diversifying, putting small amounts in various altcoins – you know, the penny stocks of the crypto world. Some went nowhere, others gave me a ten to twenty percent return.

unnormalised: Now, I mostly stick to the big boys - BTC and ETH. I still dabble in smaller coins, but only with money I’m prepared to lose. I usually invest around Rs. 2000-3000 a month, depending on the market conditions. I also keep an eye on international markets, as prices are heavily influenced by places like the U.S. and China.
normalised: Now, I mostly stick to the big boys - B-T-C and E-T-H. I still dabble in smaller coins, but only with money I'm prepared to lose. I usually invest around rupees two thousand to three thousand a month, depending on the market conditions. I also keep an eye on international markets, as prices are heavily influenced by places like the U-S and China.

unnormalised: So, is it a good investment? Honestly, I can't say for sure. Do your research, understand the risks, and only invest what you can afford to lose. Crypto is volatile, and you could easily see your investment drop by 30% in a day. Just remember, it's a gamble, but a calculated one can be rewarding.
